content.description: Top rope the face just to the right of the Sunset Arete. The grade varies depending on your route. Still a bit loose.

climbs.name: True Summit Direct
climbs.fa: I'm sure Ken Klis free soloed it long before it had bolts

content.description: This route gets you to the top of the highest point on Bishop Peak, the True Summit. The crux is the last move just before you top out.
content.protection: 4 draws. 2 bolt anchor on top. Bring long slings or cordellete if you want to top rope one of the adjacent harder routes.
content.location: From the Hikers Summit (or east summit)head west till you get to the cluster of rocks that look to be the highest point. Start on the east side atop the block. You can't miss it. Once you're on top, you can Top Rope Meltdown & Asymptote.

content.description: Top Rope the Arete below the summit register.
content.protection: Bring a cordelette to connect the various sketchy looking anchor bolts.

content.description: Start in the lowest cave and wind your way up and left.
Wide Crack Testpiece of the Central Coast.
content.protection: Gear to 4". Armbars, Chicken wings, Stacks, and Titanium Testicles. (Or titanium forearms for the female variety)
content.location: The obvious wide crack roof that sits under the highest block on the mountain.

content.description: Climb the arête on the northwest side of the True Summit Block. The hardest part is either getting off the ground or the mono up a little higher with the right hand, depending on your strengths. The arête stays in your left hand for most of the way.
content.protection: Bolts or Top Rope. It's been a while since I was up there, but if someone PMs me w the number of bolts on this one, I'll update the description.
content.location: The arête on the northwest side of the True Summit Block, facing towards Diablo (hence the name of the route).

content.description: Climb the north side of the True Summit Block. Not sure if anyone has ever led or climbed this route. Rumor has it that it was bolted by Ryan Bello in the 80s or early 90s.
content.protection: Bolts or Top Rope. Lead bolts need to be replaced.
content.location: The slot between the True Summit and the block with the Hiker's Register.

climbs.name: Cunning Linguist
climbs.fa: Aaron Stireman, Hunter Bonilla, Ken Klis

content.description: It looks like a short crack with a chockstone in it from far away, maybe a two move wonder at best. But it's 9 or 10 moves of fist/ow out of a roof crack, with fairly good jamming and technical feet the whole way.
content.location: Down and right of the Vertigo Aid route, but not on the marshmallow formation.

content.description:
Quality route that gets you to the highest point on the peak. Very satisfying.

Route is cleaned up well.

Crux is between bolts 2 and 3.

Favorite Route...Ever.
content.protection:
New 5th bolt as of 6-10-12 above the crux - 5 Bolts

New anchor with rap rings at the top.
content.location:
True Summit Block, right of Meltdown.

Climb the slab on the right, undercling, and lean out to make your first clip.
